statement.tex: \text{The postmaster of a local office wishes to}\\ \text{hire extra helpers during the festive season}\\ \text{because of a large increase in the volume of}\\ \text{mail handling and delivery. Because of the}\\ \text{limited office space and budgetary constraints,}\\ \text{the number of temporary helpers cannot exceed}\\ \text{10. According to past experience, a man can}\\ \text{handle 300 lettes and 80 packets per day, on}\\ \text{the average, and a woman can handle 400}\\ \text{lettes and 50 packets per day. The postmaster}\\ \text{believes that the daily volume of extra mail}\\ \text{and packets will be no less than 3400 and 680}\\ \text{respectively. A man receives ₹225 a day}\\ \text{and a woman receives ₹200 a day.}\\ \text{How many men and women should be hired to}\\ \text{keep the pay-roll at a minimum? Formulate}\\ \text{an LPP and solve it graphically.}
\\ \text{Let } m =\text{ number of men hired and}\\ w = \text{number of women hired. Given this,}\\ \text{does the table below correctly capture the}\\ \text{constraints the postmaster faces?}
\\ \text{Have the constraint lines been correctly}\\ \text{marked in the graph below?}
\\ \textbf{Right or wrong?}\\ \text{Your friend makes the following claim about}\\ \text{what the }\textbf{feasible region }\text{is.}\\ \underline{\text{Is his claim correct?}}

The line with the largest y-intercept}\\ (13.6)\text{ is for packages, followed by those}\\ \text{for workers(10) and then for letters(8.5)} \\ \textbf{Also note, }\text{that the three lines}\\ \text{intersect when }\\ \begin{align} -\frac{3}{4} m + 8.5 &= -1.6m + 13.6 \\ \implies 0.85m &= 5.1 \text{ or } m = 6, w = 10-m=4. \end{align} \\ \text{Hence, }A = (6,4).
